GamepadPose.summary: NOTE Experimental The GamepadPose interface of the Gamepad API represents the pose of a WebVR controller at a given timestamp (which includes orientation, position, velocity, and acceleration information).

remarks.para: This interface is accessible through the property.

GamepadPoseOrientation.summary: NOTE Experimental The orientation read-only property of the interface returns the orientation of the , as a quaternion value.

remarks.para: The value is a , made up of the following values:
The orientation yaw (rotation around the y axis) is relative to the initial yaw of the sensor when it was first read.

GamepadPoseOrientation.value: A , or null if the VR sensor is not able to provide orientation data.

GamepadPoseAngularVelocity.summary: NOTE Experimental The angularVelocity read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the angular velocity vector of the , in radians per second.

remarks.para: In other words, the current velocity at which the sensor is rotating around the x, y, and z axes.

GamepadPoseAngularVelocity.value: A , or null if the gamepad is not able to provide angular velocity information.

GamepadPoseLinearAcceleration.summary: NOTE Experimental The linearAcceleration read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the linear acceleration vector of the , in meters per second per second.

remarks.para: In other words, the current acceleration of the sensor, along the x, y, and z axes.

GamepadPoseLinearAcceleration.value: A , or null if the gamepad is not able to provide linear acceleration data.

GamepadPoseAngularAcceleration.summary: NOTE Experimental The angularAcceleration read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the angular acceleration vector of the , in meters per second per second.

remarks.para: In other words, the current acceleration of the sensor's rotation around the x, y, and z axes.

GamepadPoseAngularAcceleration.value: A , or null if the gamepad is not able to provide angular acceleration information.

GamepadPosePosition.summary: NOTE Experimental The position read-only property of the interface returns the position of the as a 3D vector.

remarks.para: The coordinate system is as follows:
Positions are measured in meters from an origin point â€” this point is the position the sensor was first read at.

GamepadPosePosition.value:
A , or null if the gamepad is not able to provide position data.
NOTEUser agents may provide emulated position values through certain techniques; when doing so they should still report as false.

GamepadPoseLinearVelocity.summary: NOTE Experimental The linearVelocity read-only property of the interface returns an array representing the linear velocity vector of the , in meters per second.

remarks.para: In other words, the current velocity at which the sensor is moving along the x, y, and z axes.

GamepadPoseLinearVelocity.value: A , or null if the gamepad is not able to provide linear velocity data.

GamepadPoseHasOrientation.summary: NOTE Experimental The hasOrientation read-only property of the interface returns a boolean value stating whether the can track and return orientation information.

GamepadPoseHasPosition.summary: NOTE Experimental The hasPosition read-only property of the interface returns a boolean value stating whether the can track and return position information.
